intro: Acosta sublanata, commonly known as the hairy acosta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a unique texture. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Acosta sublanata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
